intro: Pachycarpus grandiflorus subsp. grandiflorus, commonly known as the large-flowered pachycarpus, is a member of the Malvaceae family. It is a shrub characterized by its thick, fleshy stems and showy, pink to red flowers. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, adapting to harsh conditions with its succulent leaves. Its flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The species is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in dry gardens.
